info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 04 at 2:44PM EDT until May 04 at 3:15PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wakefield has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Central Prince George County in south central Virginia... Northwestern Surry County in southeastern Virginia... * Until 315 PM EDT. * At 244 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Disputanta, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to vehicles is possible. Expect wind damage to trees and powerlines. * This severe thunderstorm will be near... Burrowsville around 300 PM EDT. Cabin Point around 305 PM EDT. Claremont around 315 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include Taylors Corner, Carsley, Prince George Golf, Spring Grove, Gwaltney Corner, Oak Hill Corner, Savedge and Barham. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Large hail and damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Please report severe weather by calling 757-899-2415, posting to the NWS Wakefield Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSWAKEFIELDVA.
